data.enText: the act of causing sb severe pain in order to punish them or make them say or do sth

data.chText: 许多难民都遭受过拷打。
data.enText: Many of the refugees have suffered torture.
His confessions were made under torture .

data.chText: 我听说过监狱里令人毛骨悚然的刑讯。
data.enText: I heard stories of gruesome tortures in prisons.

data.chText: （精神上或肉体上的）折磨，痛苦；折磨人的事物
data.enText: mental or physical suffering; sth that causes this

data.chText: 这次面试从头至尾使人备受煎熬。
data.enText: The interview was sheer torture from start to finish.
to hurt sb physically or mentally in order to punish them or make them tell you sth

data.chText: 反叛者中许多人被捕并遭受到秘密警察的酷刑。
data.enText: Many of the rebels were captured and tortured by secret police.

data.chText: 他受不住酷刑被迫向他们供出了情报。
data.enText: He was tortured into giving them the information.

data.chText: 使痛苦；使苦恼；使焦急；使受煎熬
data.enText: to make sb feel extremely unhappy or anxious

data.chText: 童年的记忆使他痛苦了一辈子。
data.enText: He spent his life tortured by the memories of his childhood.

simple_means.memory_skill: tort 扭曲 + ure 表行为 → 扭曲〔别人〕→ 折磨

tr: the deliberate, systematic, or wanton infliction of physical or mental suffering by one or more persons in an attempt to force another person to yield information or to make a confession or for any other reason
example: it required unnatural torturing to extract a confession

tr: the act of distorting something so it seems to mean something it was not intended to mean

example: The sinners will be tormented in Hell, according to the Bible

value.def: If someone is tortured, another person deliberately causes them great pain over a period of time, in order to punish them or to make them reveal information.

example.ex: French police are convinced that she was tortured and killed...
example.tran: 法国警方确信她是被拷打致死。

example.ex: Three members of the group had been tortured to death…
example.tran: 该团体中有三个人被拷打致死。

example.ex: They never again tortured a prisoner in his presence.
example.tran: 他们再也没有当他的面严刑拷打过囚犯。

example.ex: ...alleged cases of torture and murder by the security forces...
example.tran: 指控安全部队严刑拷问和谋杀的案例

example.ex: Many died under torture, others committed suicide…
example.tran: 很多人被酷刑折磨致死，另一些人则选择了自杀。

example.ex: I had thought this was a medieval torture that had mercifully disappeared.
example.tran: 我还以为这是中世纪的酷刑，早已令人庆幸地不复存在了。

value.def: To torture someone means to cause them to suffer mental pain or anxiety.

example.ex: He would not torture her further by trying to argue with her...
example.tran: 他不愿与她争辩，让她更痛苦。

example.ex: She tortured herself with fantasies of Bob and his new girlfriend.
example.tran: 她想象着鲍勃和他的新女友在一起的情形，心里备受煎熬。

value.def: If you say that something is torture or a torture, you mean that it causes you great mental or physical suffering.

example.ex: Waiting for the result was torture...
example.tran: 等待结果的过程是一种折磨。

example.ex: The friction of the sheets against his skin was torture…
example.tran: 被单摩擦着他的皮肤，简直像是酷刑。

example.ex: Learning — something she had always loved — became a torture.
example.tran: 学习——她一直喜欢的事情——变成了一种痛苦。

value.tran: 折磨;痛苦;苦恼;引起痛苦(或苦恼)的事物

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 加强 + tort 扭曲 → 扭曲；曲解
con 加强 + tort 扭曲 + ion 表名词 + ist 从事某职业的人 → 柔术演员（能把身体全部扭曲的人）
partsOfSpeech.d: 柔术演员（能把身体全部扭曲的人）

partsOfSpeech.dec: dis 分散 + tort 扭曲 → 扭开 → 曲解
ex 出 + tort 扭曲 → 强扭出来 → 强夺
re 回 + tort 扭曲 → 反着扭 → 反驳
tor〔= tort〕扭曲 + ment 表名词 → 扭的状态 → 苦恼
tors 扭曲 + ion 动作或状态 → 扭转力
tort 扭曲 + uous …的 → 曲折的
tort 扭曲 + ure 表行为 → 扭曲〔别人〕→ 折磨

rootsaffixes.indicate: 表名词，“行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物”
rootsaffixes.title: -ure, -ture, -ature, -iture

partsOfSpeech.dec: cens 审查；判断 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 责难
close 关闭 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 关闭
compose 使平静 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 镇定，沉着
con 共同 + ject 扔 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 共同抛出自己的假想 → 推测
divest 剥夺 + iture 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 剥夺
expend 花费 + iture 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 支出
fail 失败 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 失败
flex 弯曲 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 弯曲
fract 破碎，打碎 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 骨折；断裂
mini 小 + ature 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 小画像；缩影
mix 混合 + ture 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 混合物
press 压 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 压力
script 写 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 经文；文稿
sign 签字 + ature 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 签名
tort 扭曲 + ure 行为 → 酷刑；折磨
